perturbation.original_text:
1    PURPOSE  OF  THE  AGREEMENT

     1.1  The purpose  of  this  content  distribution  Agreement  (hereinafter           "Agreement")  is  to  set  forth  the terms and conditions under which           plan_b  may  use  the  Content  ("Content" as set forth in APPENDIX 2)           owned  or  licensed  by  LICENSOR  for  a  commercial  distribution to           plan_b's  End  Users  in  the  territory  ("Territory" as set forth in           APPENDIX  2).
perturbation.changed_text:
1    PURPOSE  OF  THE  AGREEMENT

     1.1  The purpose  of  this  content  distribution  Agreement  (hereinafter           "Agreement")  is  to  set  forth  the terms and conditions under which           plan_b  may  use  the  Content  ("Data" as set forth in APPENDIX 2)           owned  or  licensed  by  LICENSOR  for  a  commercial  distribution to           plan_b's  End  Users  in  the  territory  ("Territory" as set forth in           APPENDIX  2).
perturbation.explanation: Changing "Content" to "Data" in Section 1.1 while Appendix 2 still defines the term as "Content" creates confusion and contradiction. It becomes unclear if plan_b can use all types of data, or just the content as specified in the appendix. This could lead to disputes about what exactly is licensed.

perturbation.original_text: 2.3  LICENSOR  grants  plan_b  for  the  term  of  this Agreement the right           to  produce,  market  and  distribute  Content  to  End  Users (in the           territory  specified  in appendix 2) through its own and its partner's           platform.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.3  LICENSOR  grants  plan_b  for  the  term  of  this Agreement the right           to  produce,  market  and  distribute  Material  to  End  Users (in the           territory  specified  in appendix 2) through its own and its partner's           platform.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing "Content" with "Material" creates ambiguity as the contract defines "Content," but not "Material." This could be problematic because it is not clear what falls under "Material," possibly leading to disputes about what plan_b has rights to distribute. "Material" is broader than "Content" and may not be the true intention of what the contract should cover.

perturbation.original_text:
3    OBLIGATIONS  OF  PLAN_B

     3.1  plan_b  will  distribute  Content  to  End  Users  in  the  Territory           through  its  distribution  channels.
perturbation.changed_text:
3    OBLIGATIONS  OF  PLAN_B

     3.1  plan_b  will  disseminate  Content  to  End  Users  in  the  Territory           through  its  distribution  channels.
perturbation.explanation: Changing "distribute" to "disseminate" creates a subtle, but potentially significant difference. "Distribute" implies a more formal and controlled process, whereas "disseminate" suggests a broader and potentially less controlled spread of the content. This shift may lead to disagreement about whether plan_b is adhering to the original intent of the agreement concerning content control and reach to the End Users.
